required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Of Lorlatinib Versus Crizotinib In First Line Treatment Of Patients With ALK-Positive NSCLC
clinical_study.official_title: A PHASE 3, RANDOMIZED, OPEN-LABEL STUDY OF LORLATINIB (PF-06463922) MONOTHERAPY VERSUS CRIZOTINIB MONOTHERAPY IN THE FIRST-LINE TREATMENT OF PATIENTS WITH ADVANCED ALK-POSITIVE NON-SMALL CELL LUNG CANCER

brief_summary.textblock: A phase 3 study to demonstrate whether lorlatinib given as monotherapy is superior to crizotinib alone in prolonging the progression-free survival in advanced ALK-positive NSCLC patients who are treatment na√Øve and to compare lorlatinib to crizotinib with respect to overall survival in the same population

primary_outcome.measure: Progression-free survival (PFS) based on blinded independent central review (BICR) assessment
primary_outcome.time_frame: From time of Study Start up to 33 months
primary_outcome.description: PFS is defined as the time from randomization to the date of the first documentation of objective progression of disease or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of Study Start up to 125 months
secondary_outcome.description: OS is defined as time from date of randomization to date of death due to any cause

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of Study Start up to 33 months
secondary_outcome.description: PFS is defined as the time from randomization to the date of the first documentation of objective progression of disease or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first.

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective Response (OR) based on BICR and on Investigator's assessments
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of Study Start up to 33 months
secondary_outcome.description: OR defined as complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) per RECIST version 1.1 recorded from randomization until disease progression or start of new anti-cancer therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Intracranial Objective Response (IC-OR) based on BICR assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of Study Start up to 33 months
secondary_outcome.description: IC-OR defined as complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) based on intracranial disease in the subset of patients with at least 1 intracranial lesion per RECIST version 1.1 (modified) recorded from randomization until disease progression or start of new anti-cancer therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Intracranial Time to Progression (IC-TTP) based on BIRC assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of Study Start up to 33 months
secondary_outcome.description: IC-TTP defined as the time from randomization to the date of the first documentation of objective progression of intracranial disease, based on either new brain metastases or progression of existing brain metastases

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Response (DR) based on BIRC assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of Study Start up to 33 months
secondary_outcome.description: DR defined, for patients with an OR per RECIST version 1.1, as the time from the first documentation of objective tumor response (CR or PR) to the first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first

secondary_outcome.measure: intracranial Duration of Response (IC-DR) based on BICR assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of Study Start up to 33 months
secondary_outcome.description: IC-DR defined, for patients with an IC-BOR of CR or PR, as the time from the first documentation of intracranial objective response (CR or PR) per RECIST 1.1 to the date of first documentation of intracranial objective progression of disease (PD) or death due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Tumor Response (TTR) based on BIRC assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of Study Start up to 33 months
secondary_outcome.description: TTR defined, for patients with a confirmed OR, as the time from the date of randomization to the first documentation of objective response (CR or PR) which is subsequently confirmed

secondary_outcome.measure: Intracranial Time to Tumor Response (IC-TTR) based on BICR assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from time of Study Start up to 33 months
secondary_outcome.description: IC-TTR is defined, for patients with a confirmed IC-OR, as the time from the date of randomization to the first documentation of intracranial objective response (CR or PR) which is subsequently confirmed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of Study Start up to 45 months
secondary_outcome.description: PFS2 is defined as the time from randomization to the date of progression of disease on first subsequent systemic anti-cancer therapy, or death from any cause, whichever occurs first

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse Event (AE) as graded by NCI CTCAE v 4.03)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of Study Start up to 33 months
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of patients experiencing treatment-emergent AEs (TEAEs)

secondary_outcome.measure: Laboratory abnormalities as graded by NCI CTCAE v 4.03)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of Study Start up to 33 months
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of patients with laboratory test abnormalities

secondary_outcome.measure: Vital signs (blood pressure, pulse rate) and body weight
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of Study Start up to 33 months
secondary_outcome.description: Summary of actual values and changes from baseline

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of Study Start up to 33 months
secondary_outcome.description: Summary of actual values and changes from baseline

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of Study Start up to 33 months
secondary_outcome.description: Summary of actual values and changes from baseline

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of Study Start up to 33 months
secondary_outcome.description: Summary of changes from screning results

secondary_outcome.measure: PRO as assessed by EORTC QLQ-C30, EORTC QLQ LC13, and EQ-5D-5L
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of Study Start up to 33 months
secondary_outcome.description: Summary of absolute scores and mean change of absolute scores from baseline

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of Study Start up to 33 months
secondary_outcome.description: Summary of baseline levels and changes from baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Peripheral blood cfDNA (circulating free Deoxyribonucleic acid) biomarkers
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of Study Start up to 33 months
secondary_outcome.description: Summary of baseline levels and changes from baseline

arm_group.description: Lorlatinib single agent, 100 mg (4 x 25 mg) oral tables, QD, continuously
Crizotinib single agent, 250 mg (1 x 250) oral capsules, BID, continuously

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of locally advanced or metastatic ALK-positive NSCLC; at least 1 extracranial measurable target lesion not previously irradiated. CNS metastases allowed if asymptomatic and not currently requiring corticosteroid treatment.
- Availability of an archival FFPE tissue specimen.
- No prior systemic NSCLC treatment.
- ECOG PS 0, 1, or 2.
- Age ‚â•18 years .
- Adequate Bone Marrow, Liver, Renal, Pancreatic Function
- Negative pregnancy test for females of childbearing potential
Exclusion Criteria:
- Spinal cord compression unless good pain control attained
- Major surgery within 4 weeks prior to randomization.
- Radiation therapy within 2 weeks prior to randomization, including stereotactic or partial brain irradiation. Whole brain irradiation within 4 weeks prior to randomization
- Active bacterial, fungal, or viral infection
- Clinically significant cardiovascular disease, active or within 3 months prior to enrollment. Ongoing cardiac dysrhythmias, uncontrolled atrial fibrillation, bradycardia or congenital long QT syndrome
- Predisposing characteristics for acute pancreatitis in the last month prior to randomization.
- History of extensive, disseminated, bilateral or presence of Grade 3 or 4 interstitial fibrosis or interstitial lung disease
- Active malignancy (other than NSCLC, non melanoma skin cancer, in situ cervical cancer, papillary thyroid cancer, LCIS/DCIS of the breast, or localized prostate cancer) within the last 3 years prior to randomization.
- Concurrent use of any of the following food or drugs within 12 days prior to the first dose of lorlatinib or crizotinib.
1. known strong CYP3A inhibitors .
2. known strong CYP3A inducers
3. known P gp substrates with a narrow therapeutic index
- Concurrent use of CYP3A substrates with narrow therapeutic indices within 12 days prior to the first dose of lorlatinib or crizotinib.
- Other severe acute or chronic medical or psychiatric condition, including recent or active suicidal ideation or behavior, or laboratory abnormality that may increase the risk associated with study participation or interfere with the interpretation of study results
- Investigational site staff members directly involved in the conduct of the study and their family members, or Pfizer employees, including their family members, directly involved in the conduct of the study.
- Participation in other studies involving investigational drug(s) within 2 weeks prior to study entry and/or during study participation.

clinical_study.keyword: ALK; anaplastic lymphoma kinase; Non-Small-Cell Lung cancer; NSCLC

patient_data.ipd_description: Pfizer will provide access to individual de-identified participant data and related study documents (e.g. protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP), Clinical Study Report (CSR)) upon request from qualified researchers, and subject to certain criteria, conditions, and exceptions. Further details on Pfizer's data sharing criteria and process for requesting access can be found at: https://www.pfizer.com/science/clinical_trials/trial_data_and_results/data_requests.
